extendedIngredients.name: crab boil seasoning
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoon crab boil seasoning (recommended: Old Bay)

extendedIngredients.name: white bread
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 slices white bread, crusts removed and torn into small pieces

recipes.title: Baltimore Orioles Maryland Crab Cakes

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Casa Catelli Pinot Grigio with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 8 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Casa Catelli Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: It has a straw yellow color. On the nose it has floral notes with hint of dry hay and fresh lemon. On the palate it has a soft citrus flavor with hints of crusty bread and acacia honey. Indeed, well balanced and pleasant to drink with and without food.

recipes.instructions: Whisk together the first 7 ingredients in a bowl and set aside.                          Spread the crabmeat on a cookie sheet and carefully remove any bits of shell. Transfer to a large bowl and toss gently with the bread. Spoon the wet mix over the crabmeat and gently fold until just combined. Allow the                          mixture to rest in refrigerator for 10 minutes.                          Shape the mixture into 12 even-sized cakes (approximately 4 ounces each). Chill the crab cakes for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight to firm up.                          Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Working in batches, fry the crab cakes, turning once, until golden brown and heated through. (Alternatively, bake in a preheated 400 degree F. oven for 15 to 20 minutes.)                          Serve immediately.

steps.step: Whisk together the first 7 ingredients in a bowl and set aside.
Spread the crabmeat on a cookie sheet and carefully remove any bits of shell.
Transfer to a large bowl and toss gently with the bread. Spoon the wet mix over the crabmeat and gently fold until just combined. Allow the
mixture to rest in refrigerator for 10 minutes.
Shape the mixture into 12 even-sized cakes (approximately 4 ounces each). Chill the crab cakes for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight to firm up.

Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Working in batches, fry the crab cakes, turning once, until golden brown and heated through. (Alternatively, bake in a preheated 400 degree F. oven for 15 to 20 minutes.)
